sourceMeaningMnemonic: Under his <radical>roof</radical>, the <radical>king</radical> stares into a <radical>drop</radical> of water containing his greatest <kanji>treasure</kanji>. Just kidding, the king has way more treasure than that. The drop of water is just reflecting what's around him: mounds and mounds of treasure, stacked all the way up to the roof.
meaningInfo: Picture the treasure reflected in the drop of water. It's marvelous!
readingMnemonic: All of this <kanji>treasure</kanji> is kept in the king's <reading>ho</reading>me (<ja>ほう</ja>). He can't let other people see how much treasure he has, or they'll get mad, or worse(!) ask him to share some with his people. Yuck. The treasure stays at home.
readingInfo: Picture his home from the outside. It looks like a normal, small castle. But then you walk in and it's a treasure trove of... well, treasure!
